modules.description: Injects source code position information into expressions, replacing [%here] with a `Lexing.position` value. Operates on OCaml syntax trees during preprocessing, capturing exact file, line, and column details. Enables runtime tracking of code origins, useful for error messages or debugging metadata.

Provides functions to capture and manipulate source code positions, including retrieving file names, line numbers, and character offsets. Works with the `Lexing.position` type to track locations within OCaml source files. Used to generate precise error messages and debug information during macro expansion.

Provides functions to manipulate and embed location data from OCaml's parser, including converting positions to expressions or strings and managing directory names for filename expansion. Works with location objects, strings, and options. Used to generate precise error messages and handle file paths in macro expansions during compilation.
